intro: Anemocarpa, commonly known as the wind fruit, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its unique, spherical fruit that resembles a small, hairy ball, which aids in wind dispersal of its seeds. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and is native to regions of southern Africa. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The botanical features of Anemocarpa make it well adapted to arid environments and efficient in seed distribution.
